scenario.title: European Market Expansion Decision
scenario.question: Should we enter the European market this quarter?

marketContext.narrative: Bloom & Co. is a direct-to-consumer beauty brand that has grown 41% YoY in the US market. With strong Q4 2024 results ($29.6M revenue) and increasing customer retention (128K active customers), leadership is evaluating international expansion. Three major EU competitors have recently raised Series B rounds, creating urgency around the European market opportunity.
keyFactors: UK, Germany, and France represent 65% of addressable EU market
Category has 3 established EU players but none dominant
GDPR compliance requires 3-4 months of engineering work
Two of top 10 US customers already requesting EU data centers
EU expansion adds estimated $2M to next year's costs

councilPrompt: Should Bloom & Co. enter the European market this quarter? Context: Bloom & Co. is a DTC beauty brand founded in 2019 (Austin, TX) with 120-150 employees. Currently US-only, they've grown 41% YoY to $29.6M Q4 2024 revenue with 128K active customers. Three EU competitors just raised Series B. Key considerations: EU market growing 18% YoY, GDPR compliance needs 3-4 months, two top customers want EU data centers, expansion costs ~$2M.

suggestedPersonas.focus: unit economics, FX risk, investment timing

expectedOutcomes.note: Run multiple iterations to capture how fields evolve through stages (problem-definition -> ideation -> critique -> integration -> decision)
